title: How to Cook Corned Beef in a Slow Cooker

steps.title: Shop for a brisket at your local supermarket or butcher's shop.
steps.content: Shop for a brisket at your local supermarket or butcher's shop.

steps.title: Choose a brisket that is about 3 to 4 lbs.
steps.content: Choose a brisket that is about 3 to 4 lbs. (1.3 to 1.8kg). This size will fit well in most slow cookers. If you have a smaller slow cooker, you may need to cut your brisket into a manageable size.

steps.title: Defrost the beef brisket for 24 to 48 hours in the refrigerator if it is frozen.
steps.content: Defrost the beef brisket for 24 to 48 hours in the refrigerator if it is frozen.

steps.title: Remove the beef brisket from the refrigerator.
steps.content: Remove the beef brisket from the refrigerator. Leave it to rest covered on the counter for 30 to 60 minutes. It will come to room temperature.

steps.title: Mix your pickling spices.
steps.content: Mix your pickling spices. In place of mixing your own, you can also use the spice packet that is often sold with a corned beef brisket. If you are mixing your own, try 1/4 cup of brown sugar, 1 tbsp. of pink pickling salt, 1 bay leaf and 2 crushed garlic cloves. Add 1/2 tbsp. of the following: dill seeds, black peppercorns, allspice berries and dried thyme. Add 1/4 tbsp. of hot red pepper flakes, mustard seeds, coriander seeds, celery seeds, ground ginger and whole cloves.

steps.title: Rub the brisket all over with the pickling spices.
steps.content: Rub the brisket all over with the pickling spices. Place it in your slow cooker.

steps.title: Clean and peel carrots, potatoes, rutabaga and/or onions and a leek.
steps.content: Clean and peel carrots, potatoes, rutabaga and/or onions and a leek. Choose the vegetables you like best.

steps.title: Cut into 4 inch (10cm) pieces.
steps.content: Cut into 4 inch (10cm) pieces. Layer them on the brisket in the following order: rutabaga, potatoes, carrots, onions or leek.

steps.title: Pour enough water into the slow cooker to almost cover the brisket.
steps.content: Pour enough water into the slow cooker to almost cover the brisket.

steps.title: Plug in the slow cooker.
steps.content: Plug in the slow cooker. Place the cover over the beef and vegetables.

steps.title: Set the timer for 4 hours on high or 8 hours on low.
steps.content: Set the timer for 4 hours on high or 8 hours on low.

steps.title: Clean and chop up cabbage into 1.5 inch (3.8cm) wedges.
steps.content: Clean and chop up cabbage into 1.5 inch (3.8cm) wedges.

steps.title: Set a timer to go off either 1.5 hours (on low) or 45 minutes (on high) before the total cook time is done.
steps.content: Set a timer to go off either 1.5 hours (on low) or 45 minutes (on high) before the total cook time is done.

steps.title: Place the cabbage on top of the brisket and replace the lid.
steps.content: Place the cabbage on top of the brisket and replace the lid.

steps.title: Cook for 45 minutes to 1.5 hours longer.
steps.content: Cook for 45 minutes to 1.5 hours longer.

steps.title: Remove and drain the vegetables with a slotted spoon.
steps.content: Remove and drain the vegetables with a slotted spoon.

steps.title: Remove the brisket.
steps.content: Remove the brisket. Let it sit for 5 to 10 minutes while covered, then slice thinly against the grain.

steps.title: Serve immediately with mustard or horseradish.
steps.content: Serve immediately with mustard or horseradish.
